member.remarks: Only public and protected methods and properties are processed by aspect. To override the default behavior, use and .

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.Session
member.summary: DataContext analogue maintaining database connection and entity cache (identity map in the simplest case).

remarks.para: Each session maintains its own connection to the database and caches a set of materialized persistent instates.

Session implements interface, that means each Session can be either active or not active in a particular thread (see property). Each thread can contain only one active session in each point of time, such session can be a accessed via Session.Current property or Session.Demand() method.
Sessions are opened (and, optionally, activated) by Domain.OpenSession() method. Existing session can be activated by method.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Session.DisableValidation
member.summary: Opens the "inconsistent region" - the code region, in which validation is just queued for delayed execution rather then performed immediately. Actual validation will happen on disposal of .
member.returns: object, which disposal will identify the end of the region.

remarks.para: The beginning of the region is the place where this method is called.

The end of the region is the place where returned object is disposed. The validation of all queued to validate objects will be performed during disposal, if method was called on object before disposal.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Session.Persist
member.summary: Saves all modified instances immediately to the database. Obsolete, use method instead.

remarks.para: This method should be called to ensure that all delayed updates are flushed to the storage.

For non-disconnected (without option) session this method is called automatically when it's necessary, e.g. before beginning, committing and rolling back a transaction, performing a query and so further. So generally you should not worry about calling this method.
For disconnected session (with option) you should call this method manually.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Session.SaveChanges
member.summary: Saves all modified instances immediately to the database.

remarks.para: This method should be called to ensure that all delayed updates are flushed to the storage.

For non-disconnected (without option) session this method is called automatically when it's necessary, e.g. before beginning, committing and rolling back a transaction, performing a query and so further. So generally you should not worry about calling this method.
For disconnected session (with option) you should call this method manually.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Session.CancelChanges
member.summary: Cancels all changes and resets modified entities to their original state.
member.exception: Unable to cancel changes for non-disconnected session. Use transaction boundaries to control the state.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Session.DisableSaveChanges(Xtensive.Orm.IEntity)
member.summary: Temporarily disables all save changes operations (both explicit ant automatic) for specified . Such entity is prevented from being persisted to the database, when is called or query is executed. If persist is to be performed due to starting a nested transaction or committing a transaction, the presence of such an entity will lead to failure. If is not present in the database, all entities that reference are also pinned automatically.
member.returns: A special object that controls lifetime of such behavior if was not previously processed by the method, otherwise .

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Session.DisableSaveChanges
member.summary: Temporarily disables only automatic save changes operations before queries, etc. Explicit call of will lead to flush changes anyway. If save changes is to be performed due to starting a nested transaction or committing a transaction, active disabling save changes scope will lead to failure. A special object that controls lifetime of such behavior if there is no active scope, otherwise .

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.Configuration.SessionOptions.AllowSwitching
member.summary: Enables activation of this from another session having this option.

remarks.para: By default, activation of a session inside another one with running transaction (i.e. when another session is active, and transaction is already running there) leads to , since normally this indicates the same thread controls two sessions and transactions, which is dangerous (may lead to application-level deadlock).
Alternatively, this might indicate unintentional usage of data fetched by one session inside another.
So to activate one session from another, you must use either method or this option.
See description of this feature on Support@x-tensive.com for further details and examples.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.Entity
member.summary: Abstract base class for any persistent entity.

All entities in a model should be inherited from this class.

member.param: The position of persistent property inside primary key.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Orm.KeyAttribute.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of persistent property inside primary key.

remarks.para: Each key in hierarchy should have an unique position from 0 to N-1 where N is number of key fields.
Key fields positions and directions choice can be based on some optimization purposes, e.g. sometimes it can be better to have specific order and of key fields.
Default position is 0.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Orm.KeyAttribute.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort direction. Default is .
member.para: Key fields positions and directions choice can be based on some optimization purposes, e.g. sometimes it can be better to have specific order and direction of key fields.

member.exception: There is no persistent property with provided name.

member.exception: There is no persistent property with provided name.

member.param: The reference field. Field value type must be descendant.
member.exception: Field is not a reference field.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnInitialize
member.summary: Called when instance is initialized (right after constructor).

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnInitializationError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Called on instance initialization error (constructor failure).

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnGettingFieldValue(Xtensive.Orm.Model.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Called before field value is about to be read.
member.remarks: Override it to perform some actions before reading field value, e.g. to check access permissions.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnGetFieldValue(Xtensive.Orm.Model.FieldInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when field value has been read.
member.remarks: Override it to perform some actions when field value has been read, e.g. for logging purposes.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnSettingFieldValueAttempt(Xtensive.Orm.Model.FieldInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Called before field value is about to be set. This event is raised on any set attempt (even if new value is the same as the current one).
member.remarks: Override it to perform some actions before setting field value, e.g. to check access permissions.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnSettingFieldValue(Xtensive.Orm.Model.FieldInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Called before field value is about to be changed. This event is raised only on actual change attempt (i.e. when new value differs from the current one).
member.remarks: Override it to perform some actions before changing field value, e.g. to check access permissions.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Persistent.OnSetFieldValue(Xtensive.Orm.Model.FieldInfo,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when field value has been changed.
member.remarks: Override it to perform some actions when field value has been changed, e.g. for logging purposes.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.HierarchyRootAttribute
member.summary: Defines root type of hierarchy of persistent types.

remarks.para: All entities in your model can be divided into one or more persistent hierarchies. Persistent hierarchy is a set of entities, that are inherited from one entity class(hierarchy root) and have the same key structure. Hierarchy root entity should be marked by this attribute.

Persistent hierarchies can use different inheritance schemes, e.g. all instances of hierarchy can be stored in a single table or different tables should be crated for each entity class. Inheritance schema can be specified in property.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.HierarchyRootAttribute.#ctor(Xtensive.Orm.Model.InheritanceSchema)
member.param: The inheritance schema for the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Orm.HierarchyRootAttribute.InheritanceSchema
member.summary: Gets the inheritance schema for this hierarchy.
member.remarks: Persistent hierarchies can use diffirent inheritance schemas, e.g. all instances of hierarchy can be stored in a single table or different tables should be crated for each entity class.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Orm.HierarchyRootAttribute.IncludeTypeId
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether key should include TypeId field.
member.remarks: TypeId can be included into entity Key for some specific optimization purposes. Default value is .

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.Model.InheritanceSchema
member.summary: Enumerates all supported 'class to tables mapping' schemes.
member.remarks: See M.Fowler - "Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture".

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.Model.InheritanceSchema.Default
member.summary: Is equal to .

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.Model.InheritanceSchema.ClassTable
member.summary: One table per class in the inheritance structure. Inherited properties are stored in the parent class.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.Model.InheritanceSchema.SingleTable
member.summary: Maps all fields of all classes of an inheritance structure into a single table.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.Model.InheritanceSchema.ConcreteTable
member.summary: One table for each concrete class in the inheritance hierarchy. Inherited properties are duplicated in the descendant tables.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Orm.Validation.ValidationContext.DisableValidation
member.summary: Opens the "inconsistent region" - the code region, in which Validate method should just queue the validation rather then perform it immediately.
member.returns: object, which disposal will identify the end of the region. , if is .

remarks.para: The beginning of the region is the place where this method is called.
The end of the region is the place where returned object is disposed. The validation of all queued to-validate objects will be performed during disposal.

member.summary: Base class for any storage-level exception.

member.summary: An exception that is thrown when RDBMS detects a violation of a constraint.

member.summary: An exception that is thrown when a CHECK constraint violation is detected. This also includes violations of a NOT NULL constraints.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.ConnectionErrorException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when a connection error occured.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.VersionConflictException
member.summary: Thrown by , and similar methods to indicate version check didn't pass.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.ReprocessableException
member.summary: Base class for any storage-level error, that can be recovered by rolling back active transaction and reprocessing all actions in a new one.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.DeadlockException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when deadlock is detected by RDBMS.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.OperationTimeoutException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when currently executing operation is timed out.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.ReferentialConstraintViolationException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when referential constaint (aka foreign key) is violated. This differs from . is thrown when RDBMS detects a violation. is thrown when internal referential integrity mechanism detects a violation.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.SyntaxErrorException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when generated RDBMS query has syntax error(s). When you've got this exception, you either did not configured access permissions in your RDBMS, or you've found an error in DataObjects.Net.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.UniqueConstraintViolationException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when unique constaint is violated, this also denotes violation of a unique or primary index.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.TransactionSerializationFailureException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when RDBMS can not serialize concurrent access It's nearly the same as , but this one is normally thrown for RDBMS that implement multi-version concurrency control (MVCC) isolation. This exception is unrelated to .NET serialization!

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.Structure
member.summary: Abstract base class for any persistent structure. Persistent structures are types having behavior - they have no keys, and thus can be stored only as parts of entities.

remarks.para: Like , structures support inheritance and consist of one or more persistent fields (properties) of scalar, , or type.
However unlike entity, structure is not identified by and has value type behavior: it can be stored only inside some entity.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.Skip
member.summary: Minimal validation is performed. Assembly versions are checked. Type identifiers are extracted.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.Validate
member.summary: Validation only mode. will be thrown if storage schema differs from the expected one.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.Recreate
member.summary: Recreates all the necessary structures. Storage will contain no instances after this type of update.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.Perform
member.summary: Storage upgrade will be performed. Missing columns and tables will be added, unmapped columns and tables will be removed.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.PerformSafely
member.summary: Storage upgrade will be performed. Missing columns and tables will be added, unmapped columns and tables will be removed only if there are corresponding hints.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.LegacySkip
member.summary: Legacy database support mode. No validation is performed. Use at your own risk.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Orm.DomainUpgradeMode.LegacyValidate
member.summary: Legacy database support mode. Similar to , but schema comparison is limited to comparison of tables and columns, everything else is ignored. will be thrown if storage schema significantly differs from the expected one.

member.summary: Default upgrade mode. The same as

member.summary: The same as for backward compatibility.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Orm.EntitySet`1
member.summary: Unordered persistent -bound set (i.e. there can be no duplicates).
member.typeparam: The type of the entities in this set.

remarks.para: Use when you need to declare persistent property of entity set type.

EntitySets can be used as a paired property with reference (One-To-Many) or EntitySet (Many-To-Many) properties. In such case DataObjects.Net automatically modifies collection or it's paired property. If paired property is not specified, auxiliary table will be automatically created in database.
EntitySet class implements interface and fully supported by DataObjects.Net LINQ translator.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Orm.AssociationAttribute.PairTo
member.summary: Indicates that association (persistent collection or persistent field) is inverse end of another another collection or reference field.

remarks.para: When reference field is paired to another reference field, their value is automatically synchronized.

When collection is paired to reference field (One-to-Many association), it does not allocate any space in the database and all operations on this EntitySet are automatically synchronized to paired reference field.
When collection is paired to another collection (Many-to-Many) association, auxiliary table will be automatically created to support this association.

member.summary: Gets or sets the index filter expression.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Model.Index.IsUnique
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that this index is unique index. Unique index is one in which no two rows are permitted to have the same index key value.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Model.Index.IsFullText
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that this index is unique index. Unique index is one in which no two rows are permitted to have the same index key value.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Model.Index.IsBitmap
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that this index is bitmap index. A bitmap index is a special kind of index that stores the bulk of its data as bitmaps and answers most queries by performing bitwise logical operations on these bitmaps.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Model.Index.IsClustered
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that this index is clustered index. Clustered index is the index in which the logical order of the key values determines the physical order of the corresponding rows in a table. The bottom, or leaf, level of the clustered index contains the actual data rows of the table. A table or view is allowed one clustered index at a time.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Model.Index.FillFactor
member.summary: Specifies a percentage that indicates how full the database server should make the leaf level of each index page during index creation or rebuild.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Model.Index.Filegroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that specified index will be created on the specified tablespace or filegroup. If no location is specified and the table or view is not partitioned, the index uses the same filegroup as the underlying table or view.

Format string can contain any of these placeholders:
{0}negative sign, if argument represents a negative ; , otherwise.
{1}absolute value of property.
{2}absolute value of property.
{3}absolute value of property.
{4}absolute value of property.
{5}absolute value of property.

member.summary: Levels of checking to be done when inserting or updating data through a view.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.CheckOptions.Default
member.summary: The same as .

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.CheckOptions.None
member.summary: None check options are set.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.CheckOptions.Local
member.summary: This option is identical to option except that you can update a row so that it no longer can be retrieved through the view. This can only happen when the view is directly or indirectly dependent on a view that was defined with no WITH CHECK OPTION clause.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.CheckOptions.Cascaded
member.summary: This option specifies that every row that is inserted or updated through the view must conform to the definition of the view. In addition, the search conditions of all dependent views are checked when a row is inserted or updated. If a row does not conform to the definition of the view, that row cannot be retrieved using the view.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Sql.ReferentialAction
member.summary: Defines all possible actions applicable in the case of foreign key conflict.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.ReferentialAction.NoAction
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to do nothing in the case of some foreign key conflict.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.ReferentialAction.Restrict
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to block execution of any instruction leading to foreign key conflict.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.ReferentialAction.Cascade
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to perform some cascading operation (delete or update) in order to preserve referential integrity if it violated by some executed instruction.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.ReferentialAction.SetDefault
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to assign default value to a field referenced by foreign key constraint in order to preserve referential integrity if it violated by some executed instruction.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.ReferentialAction.SetNull
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to assign NULL to a field referenced by foreign key constraint in order to preserve referential integrity if it violated by some executed instruction.

summary.para: This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

remarks.para: It is well known that RDBMS servers stores data at table columns. Most of columns requires that their values have been specified by user but there are some exceptions of that rule (e.g. or columns).

If you working on your own RDBMS driver implementation you have to provide correct information about RDBMS capabilities. As a consequence you have to specify what column categories are supported (see example below).

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ColumnFeatures.None
member.summary: RDBMS server does not support any special columns.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ColumnFeatures.Identity
member.summary: RDBMS server supports identity columns.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ColumnFeatures.Computed
member.summary: RDBMS server supports computed columns.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ColumnInfo
member.summary: Describes a table column.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ColumnInfo.Features
member.summary: Gets or sets the features of this instance.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions
member.summary: Defines all possible actions applicable in the case of foreign key conflict.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions.None
member.summary: No actions are supported.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions.NoAction
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to do nothing in the case of some foreign key conflict.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions.Restrict
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to block execution of any instruction leading to foreign key conflict.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions.Cascade
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to perform some cascading operation (delete or update) in order to preserve referential integrity if it violated by some executed instruction.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions.SetDefault
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to assign default value to a field referenced by foreign key constraint in order to preserve referential integrity if it violated by some executed instruction.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ForeignKeyConstraintActions.SetNull
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS is capable to assign NULL to a field referenced by foreign key constraint in order to preserve referential integrity if it violated by some executed instruction.

summary.para: Defines optional features for RDBMS constraints.
An exact feature set depends on a certain RDBMS capabilities.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ConstraintFeatures.None
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS does not support any additional features for its constraints.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ConstraintFeatures.Clustered
member.summary: Indicates that primary and unique key constraints can be declared clustered.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ConstraintFeatures.Deferrable
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports deferrable constraints.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.ConstraintFeatures.Nullable
member.summary: Indicates that primary and unique key constraints can be applied to nullable columns.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects that describes all data types existing in database.

member.summary: Signed Byte (8 bit integer).

member.summary: Unsigned byte.

member.summary: Small integer (16 bit integer).

member.summary: Unsigned small integer (word).

member.summary: Integer (32 bit integer).

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.UInt32
member.summary: Unsigned integer.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Int64
member.summary: Long integer (64 bit integer).

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.UInt64
member.summary: Unsigned long integer.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Decimal
member.summary: Numeric data type with fixed precision and scale.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Float
member.summary: Floating point number data from 3.40E + 38 through 3.40E + 38. Storage size is 4 bytes.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Double
member.summary: Floating point number data from - 1.79E + 308 through 1.79E + 308. Storage size is 8 bytes.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time data from January 1, 1753 through December 31, 9999, to an accuracy of one three-hundredth of a second (equivalent to 3.33 milliseconds or 0.00333 seconds). Values are rounded to increments of .000, .003, or .007 seconds. Storage size is 8 bytes.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Interval
member.summary: A representation of the interval data type.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Char
member.summary: Fixed-length Unicode character data of n characters. n must be a value from 1 through 4,000. Storage size is two times n bytes. The SQL-92 synonyms for nchar are national char and national character.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.VarChar
member.summary: Variable-length Unicode character data of n characters. n must be a value from 1 through 4,000. Storage size, in bytes, is two times the number of characters entered. The data entered can be 0 characters in length. The SQL-92 synonyms for nvarchar are national char varying and national character varying.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.VarCharMax
member.summary: Variable-length Unicode data with a maximum length of 230 - 1 (1,073,741,823) characters. Storage size, in bytes, is two times the number of characters entered.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Binary
member.summary: Fixed-length binary data of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 8,000. Storage size is n+4 bytes.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.VarBinary
member.summary: Variable-length binary data of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 8,000. Storage size is the actual length of the data entered + 4 bytes, not n bytes. The data entered can be 0 bytes in length. The SQL-92 synonym for varbinary is binary varying.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.VarBinaryMax
member.summary: Variable-length binary data from 0 through 231-1 (2,147,483,647) bytes.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeCollection.Guid
member.summary: A globally unique identifier (GUID).

member.name: T:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures
member.summary: Defines a list of features those are allows to describe RDBMS capabilities concerning a certain data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.None
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports nothing additional for the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.FillFactor
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports fill factor property for the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.KeyConstraint
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows key constraints for the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Multiple
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows multiple columns of the mentioned data type in a single table.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Nullable
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows null values for the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Identity
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to declare identity column of the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Default
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to specify default value for a column of the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Grouping
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports grouping operations by columns of the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Ordering
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports ordering operations by columns of the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Clustering
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to build clustered index which includes key columns of the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.Indexing
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to build index which includes key columns of the mentioned data type.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.NonKeyIndexing
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to include column of the mentioned data type as non-key part of some index.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.DataTypeFeatures.ZeroLengthValueIsNull
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS treats zero length value as NULL.

member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports filtered/partial indexes.

summary.para: Defines a list of possible transaction isolation levels.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.IsolationLevels.None
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS does not support transaction isolation.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.IsolationLevels.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to execute transactions without isolation.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.IsolationLevels.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to execute transactions with the isolation level.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.IsolationLevels.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to execute transactions with the isolation level.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.IsolationLevels.Serializable
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to execute transactions with the isolation level.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.IsolationLevels.Snapshot
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows to execute transactions with isolation level.

summary.para: Defines a list of possible horisontal partitioning types.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.PartitionMethods.None
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS does not support partitioning.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.PartitionMethods.List
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports list partitioning. List partitioning enables you to explicitly control how rows map to partitions by specifying a list of discrete values in the description for each partition.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.PartitionMethods.Range
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports range partitioning. Range partitioning maps data to partitions based on ranges of partition key values that you establish for each partition.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.PartitionMethods.Hash
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports hash partitioning. Hash partitioning maps data to partitions based on a hashing algorithm that evenly distributes rows among partitions, giving partitions approximately the same size.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.PartitionMethods.Interval
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports interval partitioning. Interval partitioning is an extension of range partitioning which instructs the database to automatically create partitions of a specified interval when data inserted into the table exceeds all of the range partitions.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures
member.summary: Defines a list of features which affects query generation.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.None
member.summary: There are no features affecting query generation.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.NamedParameters
member.summary: Indicates that it is possible to use named query parameters.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.ParameterPrefix
member.summary: Indicates that parameter prefix should be used for parameter names (in the case when option is active).

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.ExplicitJoinOrder
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS requires multi-table joins to have explicit order. (like "(a join b) join c")

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.DdlBatches
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports batch query execution for DDL statements.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.DmlBatches
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports batch query execution for DML statements.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.Hints
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports query optimizer hints.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.CrossApply
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports CROSS APPLY and OUTER APPLY operators.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.FullBooleanExpressionSupport
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS allows boolean expressions in equality/inequality comparisons, inside CASE and COALESCE operators.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.UpdateFrom
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports UPDATE ... FROM statements.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.Limit
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports result limiting operator (LIMIT and TOP).

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.Offset
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports result skipping operator (OFFSET and SKIP).

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.MulticolumnIn
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports multicolumn IN operator.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.DefaultValues
member.summary: Indicates whether RDBMS supports INSERT INTO Table DEFAULT VALUES syntax.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.RowNumber
member.summary: Indicates whether RDBMS supports ROW_NUMBER window function.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.ScalarSubquery
member.summary: Indicates whether RDBMS supports subqueries that return a scalar result.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.Paging
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports paging operators ( and ).

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.Info.QueryFeatures.Batches
member.summary: Indicates that RDBMS supports batches for both DDL and DML statements.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.Float
member.summary: Floating point number data from 3.40E + 38 through 3.40E + 38. Storage size is 4 bytes.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.Double
member.summary: Floating point number data from - 1.79E + 308 through 1.79E + 308. Storage size is 8 bytes.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time data from January 1, 1753 through December 31, 9999, to an accuracy of one three-hundredth of a second (equivalent to 3.33 milliseconds or 0.00333 seconds). Values are rounded to increments of .000, .003, or .007 seconds. Storage size is 8 bytes.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.Interval
member.summary: Datetime interval.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.Char
member.summary: Fixed-length Unicode character data of n characters. n must be a value from 1 through 4,000. Storage size is two times n bytes. The SQL-92 synonyms for nchar are national char and national character.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.VarChar
member.summary: Variable-length Unicode character data of n characters. n must be a value from 1 through 4,000. Storage size, in bytes, is two times the number of characters entered. The data entered can be 0 characters in length. The SQL-92 synonyms for nvarchar are national char varying and national character varying.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.VarCharMax
member.summary: Variable-length Unicode data with a maximum length of 2^30 - 1 (1,073,741,823) characters. Storage size, in bytes, is two times the number of characters entered.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.Binary
member.summary: Fixed-length binary data of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 8,000. Storage size is n+4 bytes.

member.name: F:Xtensive.Sql.SqlType.VarBinary
member.summary: Variable-length binary data of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 8,000. Storage size is the actual length of the data entered + 4 bytes, not n bytes. The data entered can be 0 bytes in length. The SQL-92 synonym for varbinary is binary varying.

summary.para: Variable-length binary data from 0 through 2^31-1 (2,147,483,647) bytes.
